Popular batsman Steve Smith has won the 2015 Allan Border Medal on Cricket Australia's night of nights to become the youngest recipient of the top honour in the last decade. The ceremony at the Crown Casino and Entertainment Complex in Melbourne saw the best test, one day international, Twenty20 international, female, domestic and young cricketer of the year crowned. To round out the evening former test wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist and former Australia captain and selector Jack Ryder were also inducted into the Australian Cricket Hall of Fame. ALLAN BORDER MEDAL
Winner: Steve Smith. TEST PLAYER OF THE YEAR Winner: Steve Smith. ODI PLAYER OF THE YEAR Winner: Steve Smith. T20I PLAYER OF THE YEAR Winner: Glenn Maxwell.
BELINDA CLARK AWARD
Winner: Meg Lanning. DOMESTIC PLAYER OF THE YEAR Winner: Jason Behrendorff. BRADMAN YOUNG CRICKETER OF THE YEAR
Winner: Sean Abbott.
